author: Tom Shippey
title: Science Fiction: Necessary Roughness
text:
Sci-fi authors love to imagine ever more violent entertainments being used to pacify the masses. In John Scalzi’s “Head On” (Tor, 335 pages, $25.99), the game is “Hilketa.” Two sides slug it out with swords and warhammers, with the aim of decapitating a player on the opposite side—the randomly designated “goat”—and throwing his head through the goal or hoop.
Too illegal to be likely? No, because the players are “threeps.” They’re not exactly cyborgs, or androids, or even robots—though the word must be an allusion to C-3PO...
